body:
# Bismuth

A generic, bring your own framework/engine graphics library for games and visualizations.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     bismuth:
      github: chances/bismuth
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "bismuth"

# TODO: Write usage instructions here
```

See the [API documentation](https://chances.github.io/bismuth).

### Debian Linux

Required libraries:

- [`libvulkan-dev`](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/Vulkan-Loader)
- `mesa-vulkan-drivers`

#### For NVidia GPUs

- `nvidia-driver-470`

### Running Examples

#### Triangle

##### macOS

```shell
make bin/triangle.app
open bin/triangle.app
```

##### Linux

```shell
make bin/triangle
./bin/triangle
```

## Behind the Name

Bismuth germanium oxide is one of [many other piezoelectric materials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crystal_oscillator#Other_materials) used as crystal oscillators.

> A crystal oscillator is an electronic oscillator circuit that uses the mechanical resonance of a vibrating crystal of piezoelectric material to create an electrical signal with a constant frequency.

<small>[Crystal oscillator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crystal_oscillator), Wikipedia, 2021.</small>

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (name : String, width : UInt16 = 800, height : UInt16 = 600, fullscreen = false, desired_fps = 60_u32)
constructors.args_html: (name : String, width : UInt16 = 800, height : UInt16 = 600, fullscreen = false, desired_fps = 60_u32)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(name, width, height, fullscreen, desired_fps)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: render
instance_methods.doc:
Called at intervals designated by the configured frame rate.
This is used to render the scene for each of the app's windows.
instance_methods.summary: Called at intervals designated by the configured frame rate.

def.name: run
def.body:
@active = true
self.startup
if @main_window.visible?
else
  @main_window.show
  puts("#{@name} main window shown")
end
startup_time = Time.monotonic.total_milliseconds
frame_time = Time::Span::ZERO
while @active
  desired_frame_time = 1.0 / @desired_fps
  elapsed_time = Time.measure do
    Glfw.poll_events
    if @main_window.should_close?
      @active = false
    end
    @windows.each do |window|
      window.update
    end
    tick = Tick.new(desired_frame_time, frame_time.total_seconds, startup_time)
    self.tick(tick, @main_window.input)
    @windows.each do |window|
      window.render
      self.render(window)
      if @debug
        window.title = "#{@name} - Frame time: #{sprintf("%1.2d", frame_time.total_milliseconds)}ms"
      end
    end
    self.flush
  end
  if @active
  else
    break
  end
  frame_time = elapsed_time.not_nil!
  while frame_time.total_seconds < desired_frame_time
    wait_time = (desired_frame_time * 1000) - frame_time.total_milliseconds
    frame_time = frame_time + Time.measure do
      sleep(Time::Span.new(nanoseconds: 1000000 * wait_time.to_i32))
    end
  end
end
self.shutdown
Glfw.terminate
puts("Main window destroyed")

instance_methods.name: startup
instance_methods.doc:
Called when the main loop is starting up.
Use this to set things up.
instance_methods.summary: Called when the main loop is starting up.

instance_methods.name: tick
instance_methods.doc:
Called at each iteration of the main loop.
This is when application state should be updated.
instance_methods.summary: Called at each iteration of the main loop.

def.name: create_surface

class_methods.name: from_window
class_methods.args_html: (window : Window, format : WGPU::TextureFormat, present_mode = WGPU::PresentMode::Fifo)

def.name: from_window
def.body:
if window.surface.not_nil!.is_valid?
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Window surface is not valid"))
end
self.new(LibWGPU::SwapChainDescriptor.new(label: window.title, usage: WGPU::TextureUsage::RenderAttachment, format: format, width: window.width, height: window.height, present_mode: present_mode))

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(title, width, height, fullscreen, cursor_visible)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: cursor_visible=
def.body:
Glfw.set_input_mode(@handle, Glfw::CURSOR, visible ? Glfw::CURSOR_NORMAL : Glfw::CURSOR_DISABLED)
@cursor_visible = (get_input_mode(@handle, Glfw::CURSOR)) == Glfw::CURSOR_NORMAL

def.name: size
startup
def.body:
Glfw.window_hint(Glfw::VISIBLE, @visible = false)
Glfw.window_hint(Glfw::CLIENT_API, Glfw::NO_API)
@handle = Glfw.create_window(@width, height, @title, @fullscreen ? Glfw.get_primary_monitor : Pointer(Void).null, nil)
if @handle.null?
  abort("Failed to initialize a new GLFW Window", 1)
end
@surface = Platform.create_surface(@title, @handle)
if @surface.not_nil!.is_valid?
else
  abort("Failed to create graphics surface", 1)
end
puts("Created native graphics surface for #{@title} window")

def.name: update
